metadata.name: CORS Middleware Consolidation and Dynamic Port Support
metadata.description: CORS middleware unified from 5 implementations to 1 configuration with dynamic port support

historical-problem.issue: Multiple CORS implementations across services caused inconsistent behavior

specific-violations.violation: REMOVED: auth-proxy/main.py - Directory deleted, functionality moved to auth_service

historical-problem.secondary-issue: Dynamic ports in development caused CORS failures
historical-problem.root-cause: No unified configuration management for CORS across services
historical-problem.impact: Security vulnerabilities, development friction, maintenance overhead

consolidation-resolution.unified-architecture: shared/cors_config.py as single source of truth
consolidation-resolution.standardized-implementation: All services use FastAPI's built-in CORSMiddleware

business-impact.metric: Eliminated security risks from inconsistent policies
Improved developer experience with predictable behavior

layer.name: Pattern Matching
layer.description: Use regex patterns to match any localhost origin with any port

layer.name: Extended Static List
layer.description: Expanded hardcoded list includes common development ports

layer.name: Dynamic Middleware
layer.description: CustomCORSMiddleware with localhost detection for any port

features.feature: Checks pattern matching FIRST before static lists
Service discovery integration for registered services

layer.name: Auth Service Dynamic Support
layer.description: DynamicCORSMiddleware in auth service validates localhost origins

change.modification: Pattern matching checks moved FIRST in _perform_origin_checks
change.reason: Ensures dynamic ports are accepted before checking static lists
Dedicated check for localhost origins with any port in development
Auth service needs same dynamic port support as main backend
Central configuration needs to support dynamic ports

test-categories.category: Cross-service communication with all dynamic ports

best-practices.practice: Always use pattern matching for localhost origins in development
Check patterns BEFORE static lists to maximize flexibility
Include common framework ports (React 3000, Vite 5173, Angular 4200)
Test with truly random ports to ensure robustness
Use DynamicCORSMiddleware when CORS_ORIGINS=* in development
Remember that CORS treats different ports as different origins - localhost:3000 != localhost:3001
Ensure CORS configuration explicitly includes ALL ports where services may run

references.reference: RFC 6454 - The Web Origin Concept (CORS standards)
MDN CORS Documentation - Browser CORS implementation details
